text: a reading from the prophet Isaiah arise
shine for your light has come and the
glory of the lord has risen upon you for
darkness shall cover the earth and a
thick darkness the people's but the Lord
will arise upon you and his glory will
appear over you nations shall come to
your light and Kings to the brightness
of your dawn lift up your eyes and look
around they all gather together they
come to you your sons shall come from
far away and your daughters shall be
carried on their nurses arms then you
shall see and be radiant your heart
shall thrill and rejoice because the
abundance of the sea shall be brought to
you and the wealth of the nations shall
come to you violence shall no more be
heard in your land devastation or
destruction within your borders you
shall call your walls salvation and your
gates praise the Sun shall no longer be
your light by day nor for brightness
shall the moon give light to you by
night but the Lord will be your
everlasting light and your God will be
your glory your son shall no more go
down or your moon withdraw itself for
the Lord will be your everlasting light
and your days of mourning shall be ended
the word of the Lord
